text:
Hi everyone,
This is Sambhaw.
I have been contributing in JuliaText and Flux for the past few months.
I feel that XLNET model can be a great addition to NLP in Julia. It's a state of the art model and also outperforms BERT in several instances. Moreover, it is based on the Transformer-XL structure which is one of hottest topics in NLP these days. 

Another project idea is the implementation of RoBERTa which sounds quite feasible. It is also quite robust and outperforms BERT.

This is a brief idea of the project that I have been looking forward to for GSOC-2021. 
Please suggest me how to proceed next. 
I am looking forward to discussing it with the mentors. 
Have a great day. :smile:

text: Either is fine. Depends on your interest.

elements.text: Either is fine. Depends on your interest.

text: Just a high quality Transformer-XL implementation would be fine (without a full XLNet impl)

elements.text: Just a high quality Transformer-XL implementation would be fine (without a full XLNet impl)

text: Depends really on whether you want to work on foundational stuff or more end-user tools.
